subject: And now for something completely different.
msgSnippet: A post from me that s actually on topic. :-) Over the past week, I ve been writing messages about getting my book published. I was wondering, has anyone ever
messageBody: A post from me that's actually on topic. :-) Over the past week, I've been writing messages about getting my book published. I was wondering, has anyone ever tried to get anything published in Quikscript? I first decided to publish my book because I felt that the world as a whole NEEDS to learn about how to make English spelling phonetic. I learned about Quikscript later, and later still about Unifon. I'm sure there's countless others out there, too. Although I haven't really researched Quikscript enough to become a fan of it (someone sent me the manual for it years ago, but I found it too confusing compared at the time to the simplicity of Shavian), I'd probably buy a book or two written in Quikscript, especially if it was on a subject of interest to me, but the only info I found on publication in this group was a message by tim_rice09 back on July 4th, 2006. Since I found the other groups, I was pretty impressed with the transliterated works that people posted to the files section, but so long as that's ALL that's done, phonetic spelling over all will only be seen by the general public as a pipe dream. It'll take publication for people to REALLY sit up and take notice and to build overall awareness. It doesn't really matter to me which system "wins", so long as traditional orthography ends up being the loser.
